value.title: Evaluation of variables in DAX

value.title: Filter Context in DAX
value.excerpt: Understanding the difference between a row context and a filter context is the first and most important concept to learn to use DAX correctly. This video introduces the filter context. Article and download: https://sql.bi/747800?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The

value.title: Filtering a measure in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: DAX Studio can evaluate one or more measures in a query. Marco Russo shows how to apply filters to a measure executed in DAX Studio. Continuous learning to improve your productivity!  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Use DAX iterator functions in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you'll learn about what the family of iterator functions can do and how to use them in your DAX calculations. Calculations will include custom summarizations, ranking, and concatenation.

value.title: Dynamic Outlier Detection and Visualization with DAX in Power BI
value.excerpt: Learn the theory and best methods to create a dynamic sensitive outlier detectionand customize it to your particular dataset.

value.title: #2 DAX Fridays! 101: Introduction to filter and row context
value.excerpt: Are you new to DAX and want to learn what those things called filter context and row context are? I will attempt to do just that in today's video. value.title: DAX Fridays! #105: ISINSCOPE
value.excerpt: The DAX function ISINSCOPE, allow us to work with hierarchies in Power BI. In this video I will go through an example on how to do that. This DAX function was introduced in the November 2018 Power BI Desktop Update, so make sure you have that installed if you wan to test it out.  Other resources:  DAX

value.title: DAX Fridays! #106: Power Query or DAX?

You still have to learn how to model in power bi, but this will get you far until you are there. Happy Friday!  Link to why you should

The performance of EARLIER might be slow because it theoretically, it might have to perform a number of operations
